answerText: graphs[10] This kind of route in a graph visits each vertex exactly once. The task of finding one of these in a graph is NP-complete.
heading: NASAT  |2014 | 14 | 14 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: An important result in this theory was that no one could traverse the seven bridges of Konigsberg without going over one of the bridges twice. For 10 points each:  [10] Name these mathematical constructs which consist of a group of vertices connected by one or more edges.
